content: In the quarter, we generated 19% revenue growth, including an acceleration of our organic revenue growth to 8%, over 17% adjusted EBITDA margin and sequential backlog growth, all to record levels and cash flow improved in line with typical seasonal patterns. Gross revenue of $156.5 million in the second quarter of 2022 was up 19% compared to the prior year quarter, driven by 8% organic growth with strong performance in all of our service areas as well as contributions from acquisitions. Adjusted EBITDA was $21.2 million in the quarter, up 16.7% from last year and represented 17.3% of revenue, excluding subcontractor costs. You may now go ahead. You may now go ahead. You may now go ahead. This $50-odd million in adjusted EBITDA that you anticipate doing over the next couple of quarters, are you expecting typical conversion, call it, 50%-odd to operating cash flow. You may now go ahead. You may now go ahead.
